meanings.sent1: Eating too much candy can indispose you.
meanings.sent2: The flu virus can indispose a person quickly.
meanings.sent3: Indisposing yourself with too many sweets is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain indisposed our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The spicy food indisposed his stomach for hours.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) unwilling or disinclined to do something.
meanings.sent1: The boring lecture indisposed the students to pay attention.
meanings.sent2: Her fear of heights indisposed her to try bungee jumping.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather indisposed him to go for a walk.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments indisposed her towards joining the club.
meanings.sent5: The long queue indisposed him to wait for the movie.
